intro: Oestlundorchis nonantzin, commonly known as the Mexican fairy slipper, is a rare orchid species native to Mexico. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insects. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
